Wild potatoes

Wild potatoes (Solanum sect. Petota) form a large taxon gathering 196 species distributed in Latin America, from New Mexico to Patagonia [1, 2]. My PhD project aims at understanding their reproductive isolation, i.e. the mechanisms by which they avoid interspecific hybridization.

I am especially interested in Solanum chacoense, a wild potato relative of agronomical importance, and three of its closest relatives in the phylogeny: S. gandarillasii, S. tarijense, and S. microdontum. Before going further on my project, let me say a few words about these species.

A resource for potato breeding

• Resistance to pathogens - Rhizoctonia Erwinia: [3] - PVY: [4, 5] - Bacterial wilt resistance: [6] - Verticillium wilt : [7] - Common scab: [8, 9] - Colorado potato beetle: [10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15] - Potato tuberworm: [16] • Secondary metabolism: - Glycoalkaloids: [17, 18, 19, 20, 21] - Wheat powdery mildew: [22] - Cancer: [23] • Genome: [24, 25] • Breeding techniques: [26, 27]

A model for plant reproduction research

Being a diploid species, S. chacoense is also studied as an alternative model to potato for molecular and cellular biology, especially in plant reproduction research. For instance, in our institute, S. chacoense has been used in the Cappadocia lab to decipher the mechanisms underlying S-RNase-based gametophytic self-incompatibility [28, 29, 30, 31]. The Geitmann lab, now at McGill University, used S. chacoense in their research about cytomechanics of pollen tube growth [32, 33, 34].

The Matton lab uncovered various proteins involved in reproductive signal transduction pathways in S. chacoense, including RALF peptides [35, 36], MAP kinases [37, 38, 39, 40] and receptor-like kinases [41, 42, 43, 44]. Our lab also produced large-scale transcriptomic [45], proteomic [46] and secretomic [47] studies about S. chacoense reproduction.

Hybridization: [48, 49, 50, 51] Pollen-med. Gene flow: [52]

My PhD project aims at understanding their reproductive isolation, i.e. the mechanisms by which they avoid interspecific hybridization.
